<extra_id_0> Cd45.1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Rag2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice were purchased from Jackson ImmunoResearch Laboratories and Taconic , respectively .

For the in vivo <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> conversion assay , naive <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells from <extra_id_0> Cbfb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - <extra_id_0> cre <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or control mice ( harboring a <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - IRES - <extra_id_0> GFP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> allele ) were adoptively transferred into <extra_id_0> Rag <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - deficient mice .
5 x 106 cells were used per transfer .

6 wk later , <extra_id_0> TCRbeta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + gated cells from the spleen , mesenteric lymph node ( MLN ) , and lamina propria of the small intestine were analyzed for <extra_id_0> Foxp3-GFP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression .
All analyses and experiments were performed on animals at 6-8 wk of age .

Animals were housed under specific pathogen-free conditions at the animal facility of the Skirball Institute , and experiments were performed in accordance with approved protocols for the New York University Institutional Animal Care and Usage Committee .
